results.title: Sharing the Leadership
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Explores three categories of individual action and their relation to group leadership: self-serving functions, task functions and group serving functions.

results.title: Bedtime Stories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged one to five years old.

results.title: Dodo in Pukcab Land
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo saves the day for the absent-minded Professor Fingers when he diverts the train the Professor is travelling on from a collision - only problem is DoDo diverts the train into Pukcab Land where everything is backwards. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo helps Interpol
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo helps Interpol catch card cheats on an ocean liner. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo and the Touchies
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 52 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo helps the inhabitants on the planet Laugh/Cry who are under threat of invasion by inhabitants of another planet known as the Touchies. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: The Discovery of Fingercillin
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode Professor Fingers, wanting to become famous, discovers a new antibiotic which will hopefully cure an Arabian sheik’s only son who has been ill for over a year with a mysterious disease. DoDo and the Professor travel to Arabia with the cure and are rewarded for their work. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: Drugs and the very young
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The fourth film in the series suggests reasons why teenagers may begin to experiment with drugs. Using simulated everyday situations shows how children learn from example that drugs can bring pleasure and relief. Finally an expert outlines a program which presents real alternatives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)

results.title: The Pharmacology of drugs
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The third film in the series presents a systematic discussion of drugs and their effects. Examines all classes of drugs, then urges that drug abuse education focus on the dangers of alcohol and cigarettes with an emphasis equal to that placed on other drugs. With Dr James Fadiman.

results.title: Drugs: The Children are choosing - The Need for dialogue
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
Reports on a conference in which students and teachers have difficulties in communicating about drugs. Finally the frustrations and problems childhood emerge and it is suggested that it is no wonder young people turn to drugs for escape and pleasure.

results.title: What some communities are doing
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The sixth film in the series describes two broadly based educational efforts to deal with the problem of youthful drug abuse: (1) designed by a school district; and (2) a community effort by some affluent suburbs. Emphasises the need for a total community commitment and planning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
